t: Psalm 7
The Lord Implored to Defend the Psalmist against the Wicked.
A Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning Cush, a Benjamite.
O*pn Lord*s my God, in You I have taken refuge; Save*ln me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,
Or*ln he will tear my soul like a lion, Dragging*ln me away, while there is none to deliver.
O*ln Lord*s my God, if I have done this, If*ln there is injustice in my hands,
If*ln I have rewarded evil to my friend, Or*ln have plundered him who without cause was my adversary,
Let*ln the enemy pursue my soul and overtake it;*i And*ln let him trample my life down to the ground And*ln lay my glory in the dust. Selah.
Arise,*ln O Lord,*s in Your anger; Lift*ln up Yourself against the rage of my adversaries, And*ln arouse Yourself for me; You have appointed judgment.
Let*ln the assembly of the peoples encompass You, And*ln over them return on high.
The*ln Lord*s judges the peoples; Vindicate*ln me, O Lord,*s according to my righteousness and my integrity that is in me.
O*ln let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous; For*ln the righteous God tries the hearts and minds.
My*ln shield is with God, Who*ln saves the upright in heart.
God*ln is a righteous judge, And*ln a God who has indignation every day.
If*ln a man does not repent, He will sharpen His sword; He*ln has bent His bow and made it ready.
He*ln has also prepared for Himself deadly weapons; He*ln makes His arrows fiery shafts.
Behold,*ln he travails with wickedness, And*ln he conceives mischief and brings forth falsehood.
He*ln has dug a pit and hollowed it out, And*ln has fallen into the hole which he made.
His*ln mischief will return upon his own head, And*ln his violence will descend upon his own pate.
I*ln will give thanks to the Lord*s according to His righteousness And*ln will sing praise to the name of the Lord*s Most High.
